keyInsights.subtitle: Penetration
keyInsights.title: 7% → 82%
keyInsights.text: Panama's internet penetration rose from 7% in 2001 to nearly 82% in 2025, driven by policy reforms, market competition, and public Wi-Fi initiatives.

keyInsights.subtitle: Public Wi-Fi
keyInsights.title: Internet para Todos
keyInsights.text: Government-led programs like 'Internet Para Todos' and Infoplazas provided free access in cities and rural areas, reducing the digital divide.

keyInsights.subtitle: Mobile
keyInsights.text: Panama moved from EDGE in the 2000s to nationwide 4G and early 5G trials by 2024, with 95% population coverage and 118% mobile penetration.

keyInsights.subtitle: ISP Market
keyInsights.title: Duopoly by 2022
keyInsights.text: The telecom sector consolidated into a duopoly (Tigo and C&W+Claro) by 2022 after Digicel's exit. Foreign investment drove infrastructure upgrades.

keyInsights.subtitle: Digital Strategy
keyInsights.title: 2024–2030 Plan
keyInsights.text: The 2024–2030 strategic plan promotes AI, IoT, and fintech, aiming for full broadband coverage and a cash-light, digitally inclusive economy.
